header.title: Satanismo Tradicional, Nacional-Socialismo, e o Aeon Faustiano

central_thesis: This text aims to clarify and detail the philosophy and practical system of Traditional Satanism, as embodied by the Order of Nine Angles (ONA). It distinguishes ONA's elitist path of self-overcoming and connection to acausal forces from Modern/LaVeyan Satanism, arguing for the necessity of societal transformation through National Socialist principles to usher in a new 'Faustian Aeon' and the emergence of the 'Super-Homem'.

structure_content.summary: The author, Luís Gonçalves, introduces the purpose of the text: to clarify facts about the Order of Nine Angles (ONA), differentiate between Modern and Traditional Satanism, and provide a comprehensive guide to Traditional Satanism, which he considers ONA's system to be par excellence due to its logic, structure, and controversial originality.

structure_content.chapter_title: 1) SATANISMO TRADICIONAL OU MODERNO - Como diferenciar
structure_content.summary: This section outlines the core differences between Modern (LaVeyan) and Traditional (ONA) Satanism. Modern Satanism is presented as humanistic atheism focused on ego gratification and natural instincts, often leading to unproven self-proclamations of divinity. Traditional Satanism, by contrast, is a difficult, elitist path requiring the 'annulment of the Ego' to bring 'sinister and chaotic forces' (Dark Gods) from beyond causal notions of good/evil into the world, emphasizing intellectual and physical supremacy through rigorous self-testing.

This chapter refutes Anton LaVey's idea that Satanists are born, arguing instead that one *becomes* Satânico. Drawing from an interview with Vilnius Thornian of the ONA, it emphasizes that genuine Satânic character is forged through experience, struggle, learning from errors, achieving success, and pursuing absolute excellence. It criticizes 'first degree' American Satanism for its ego-driven pretension and lack of true advancement, asserting that true Satanism is the fulfillment of potential through personal effort, not birthright.

structure_content.chapter_title: 3) A ÁRVORE DE WYRD, O ESQUEMA SEPTENÁRIO, E A AEÓNICA SATÂNICA
structure_content.summary: This section details the ONA's central cosmological and initiatory framework, the 'Tree of Wyrd.' It is described as a septenary schema illustrating 7 'Grades' of sinister initiation, associated with 7 ancient 'planets,' 7 stars, and 7 Aeons of human evolution. These 7 spheres are connected by 21 Paths, corresponding to 21 'Dark Gods' and 21 Sinister Tarot Arcanos. The text also provides planetary, alchemical, and Qabalistic parallels for these grades.

structure_content.chapter_title: 4) UNIVERSO CAUSAL E UNIVERSO ACAUSAL - O que significam?
structure_content.summary: This chapter defines the concepts of 'causal' and 'acausal' within Traditional Satanism. The causal refers to linear, logical reality bounded by good/evil, while the acausal is sinister, chaotic, and beyond mundane comprehension. These terms apply to both the human mind and the Universe. The 'Abyss' is identified as the critical point between the causal (lower 4 spheres of the Tree of Wyrd) and acausal (upper 3 spheres), where the initiate sacrifices their causal ego to awaken their 'Acausal Self' and confront 'Dark Gods.' This involves opening 'nexions' or 'Star Gates' to bring these acausal forces into the causal world, with the understanding that this path can lead to madness or death if one is unprepared. Practitioners are left to decide if Dark Gods are real entities or psychological factors.

structure_content.chapter_title: 5) A SENHORA DA TERRA (BAPHOMET) E O CULTO DA CABEÇA DE SATANÁS
structure_content.summary: This section explores the ancient origins of Traditional Satanism, rooted in the worship of a dual Goddess (Lady of the Earth, Baphomet) and God (Lord of the Earth, Satanas), each with causal (Lucifer, Gaia) and acausal (Satanas, Baphomet) aspects. It provides an in-depth etymological and historical argument for 'Baphomet' meaning 'Mother of Blood,' linking it to ancient Sinister Goddesses and the Templars' veneration of a bearded, demon-like severed head. This head, associated with the 'Demon Star' Algol, symbolized the sacrificed Lord of the Earth (Satanas) and was believed to bring fertility, wealth, and protection, drawing parallels to Celtic, Tantric, Aztec, and Mayan head cults.

structure_content.chapter_title: 6) NACIONAL-SOCIALISMO E O AEON FAUSTIANO - O Caminho do Oeste
structure_content.summary: This chapter explicitly connects Traditional Satanism with National Socialism. It posits that Western society has been 'poisoned' by Judeo-Christian values, hindering human evolution. The goal is to usher in the 'Faustian Aeon' – a new, elitist, Satanic world order ruled by a 'Superior Race.' This involves a seven-point strategy: dismantling existing social/political systems (potentially through terror and chaos) to establish totalitarian governance (National-Socialist, Promethean, Luciferian); destabilizing the Soviet Union and promoting Nazism; undermining capitalist structures in the USA; disseminating heretical ideas for mental manipulation; raising a VINDEX (Avenger) leader for a global N.S. Empire; space colonization; and performing rituals to open 'Star Gates' for sinister energies to manifest, leading to the 'Super-Homem' (Satanic Race) and a 'Galactic Empire'.

The concluding chapter reinforces the concept of the 'Super-Homem' (Übermensch) as the ultimate aim of the Traditional Satanic path. It uses quotes from Friedrich Nietzsche's 'The Antichrist' to characterize the Super-Homem as intelligent, strong, self-overcoming individuals who find joy in difficulty, hardship, and self-mastery, dominating not out of desire but inherent superiority, ultimately transcending humanity itself.

key_concepts.definition: An elitist, initiatory path focused on radical self-overcoming, ego annulment, and the attainment of intellectual and physical supremacy. Its goal is to bring acausal, sinister forces (Dark Gods) into the causal world to usher in a new Aeon.
A humanistic and atheistic philosophy centered on ego gratification and natural instincts, often criticized by ONA for lacking genuine transformation and being superficial.

A concept referring to vast historical epochs or 'ages' of human evolution, each governed by specific energies or archetypes. The ONA seeks to usher in the 'Faustian Aeon', a new era of elitist, Satanic rule.

The ONA's septenary cosmological and initiatory framework, analogous to the Qabalistic Tree of Life, consisting of 7 grades/spheres (corresponding to planets, stars, Aeons) and 21 connecting paths (representing Dark Gods/Sinister Tarot Arcanos).
Refers to the conventional, linear, logical, and limited reality bound by concepts of good and evil, often associated with the ego and mundane consciousness.
Refers to the sinister, chaotic, and non-linear reality that exists beyond causal limitations and human comprehension, the domain of Dark Gods and powerful primal energies.

The crucial point or transition between the causal and acausal realms on the Tree of Wyrd. It is where the initiate sacrifices their causal ego to awaken their Acausal Self and confront Dark Gods, a potentially perilous process leading to enlightenment, madness, or death.
Chaotic, sinister, and acausal forces that exist beyond human notions of good and evil. They are central to Traditional Satanism, and the goal is to bring their influences into the causal world.

The 'Avenger' or 'Sacrifice,' a chosen individual (Sacerdote) who plays the role of the 'Lord of the Earth' (Satanas) in ancient rituals, undergoing ritual sacrifice (decapitation) to become 'Immortal' and unite with the Dark Gods. The severed head is then venerated.

The 'Mother of Blood,' representing the acausal/sinister aspect of the Goddess (Lady of the Earth) in Traditional Satanism. She is also linked to ancient head cults and the venerated severed head, embodying fertility and protection.
The acausal/sinister aspect of the God (Lord of the Earth) in Traditional Satanism, often symbolized by the severed head of the VINDEX, and linked to the 'Demon Star' Algol.
A totalitarian political ideology explicitly embraced by ONA as a means to dismantle Judeo-Christian values and establish an elitist, Satanic world order, forming the basis of the 'Faustian Aeon'.

The desired new world order envisioned by ONA, characterized by elitist, Satanic rule and the dominance of a 'Superior Race' shaped by National Socialist principles and the influence of acausal energies.

The ultimate goal of the Traditional Satanic path, inspired by Nietzsche, representing an individual who has transcended human limitations through self-overcoming, intellectual and physical supremacy, and a connection to acausal forces, ultimately leading to a 'Satanic Race'.

Points or passages (physical or metaphysical) where the causal and acausal Universes touch. These are opened through specific rituals to allow the influence of Dark Gods to enter the causal world and facilitate Aeonic change.

practical_system.description: The ONA's practical system is an elitist, initiatory path aimed at achieving radical self-overcoming and ego annulment to attain 'intellectual and physical supremacy'. The core mechanism involves navigating the 'Tree of Wyrd' through 7 grades, each correlating with alchemical processes (e.g., Calcination, Putrefaction, Exaltation) that transform the individual from a 'Neófito' to an 'Imortal'. This internal alchemy is designed to enable the initiate to cross the 'Abyss' and awaken their 'Acausal Self,' allowing direct interaction with 'Dark Gods' – chaotic, acausal forces. The ultimate goal is not merely personal transcendence but the active manipulation of causal reality through 'Star Gates' and rituals to usher in a new 'Faustian Aeon' based on National Socialist principles, leading to the creation of the 'Super-Homem' (Satanic Race) and a 'Galactic Empire'. This is achieved through both personal magical work and external actions (including social disruption and political change).
tools: The 'Árvore de Wyrd' (Tree of Wyrd) serves as the conceptual map and framework for the initiatory path, grades, and correspondences (planets, stars, Aeons, alchemical stages).
The 21 'Deuses Obscuros' and their corresponding 21 'Atus/Arcanos do Tarot Sinistro' are invoked and worked with to access specific acausal energies along the paths of the Tree of Wyrd.
Specific 'Portais Estelares' (Star Gates) are identified near stars like Algol, Dabih, Naos, and within the Solar System (near Saturn) as points for magical operations.
rituals: Specific rituals and ceremonies ('rituais específicos', 'várias cerimónias e rituais') are performed to open 'nexions' or 'Portais Estelares' (Star Gates). These gates serve as conduits to bring the influences of 'Dark Gods' (acausal energies) into the causal world.

The 'Hierosgamos' (Sacred Marriage) ritual involving a 'VINDEX' (Opfer/Sacerdote) who represents Satanas and is ritually sacrificed (decapitated) as an offering to Baphomet (Deusa Sinistra). The severed head is then venerated for its powers of fertility, wealth, and protection, symbolizing the union with acausal forces and the attainment of 'Immortality'.

relevant_quotes.text: "O Caminho Satânico Tradicional é portanto um caminho difícil e verdadeiramente Elitista, destinado aos Homens que conseguiram provar a sua Supremacia intelectual e física, e não a uma qualquer pessoa devorada pelo seu Ego inchado."

“...um dos traços mais marcantes do Caminho Satânico (Tradicional, portanto) é precisamente a *anulação do Ego*, para que se possa trazer à Terra as forças sinistras e caóticas que se situam para além das noções causais de 'bem' e 'mal', normalmente chamadas de Deuses Obscuros, que estão normalmente associadas a um dos 7 Aeons reconhecidos pela Tradição Sinistra Satânica."

“Aqueles que acreditam que simplesmente 'nasceram satânicos' não entendem o que o verdadeiro Satanismo é — na realidade eles são dominados e consumidos pelos seus próprios egos e preguiça, e são a antítese do Satanismo.”

“Este Abismo é o ponto onde o Iniciado Satânico sacrifica tudo aquilo que ele pensava que era (o seu ego e a sua mente racional e civilizada) e renasce para o seu 'Eu Acausal', despertando em si próprio as forças negras e selvagens conhecidas como os Deuses Obscuros e tornando-se Uno com elas.”
“Não existem leis indiscutíveis no Satanismo Tradicional, nem mestres nem alunos. Cada praticante deve trabalhar por si próprio.”

“A sociedade ocidental foi 'envenenada' ou empobrecida com valores judaico-cristãos que apenas vieram atrasar a evolução da Humanidade, e a inauguração do Aeon Faustiano: a Nova Ordem Mundial de natureza Elitista e Satânica, em que o poder será entregue à 'Raça Superior', a Raça Satânica constituída pelos melhores e mais fortes.”

“O tipo de Governo ou Império resultante desta reformulação seria obviamente de natureza Totalitária (Nacional-Socialista), Prometeica e Luciferiana: isto é, guiado pelas forças sinistras ou satânicas conhecidas como Deuses Obscuros, e pelos antigos valores nacionalistas e Faustianos pagãos (por exemplo os Vikings com a sua filosofia de força, guerra e competição).”

“realizar várias cerimónias e rituais para que um 'Portal Estelar' se abra e traga as influências das energias sinistras e satânicas para a Terra. Isto conduzirá sucessivamente a uma mudança geral da mentalidade das pessoas, dos acontecimentos e até da própria sociedade, no sentido da criação do Super-Homem (a Raça Satânica) e do Império Galáctico (o Aeon de Júpiter - VI°).”
“«Todos os deuses morreram; agora viva o Super-Homem!» - FRIEDRICH NIETZSCHE, 'O Anticristo'”

critical_analysis.relevance: This text is highly relevant for understanding the specific ideological and practical framework of the Order of Nine Angles (ONA), a controversial and extremist group within the broader left-hand path and Satanic milieu. It serves as a primary source for ONA's perspective, explicitly linking Traditional Satanism with National Socialism and outlining a radical vision for societal transformation through Aeonic magic and the invocation of acausal forces. Its detailed explanation of concepts like the Tree of Wyrd, Causal/Acausal realities, and the historical/mythological underpinnings of Baphomet and Satanas provides crucial insight into ONA's unique and often disturbing cosmology and methodology. It places the work firmly within the context of anti-establishment, elitist, and chaos-oriented magical traditions.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The author explicitly addresses 'all Members of the Group' and 'students and/or practitioners' interested in Traditional Satanism. Academically, the text is targeted at researchers, practitioners, and students of Western Esotericism, particularly those specializing in Satanism (Traditional vs. Modern), the occult dimensions of National Socialism, Aeonic magic, and extreme Left-Hand Path ideologies. It is also of interest to those studying extremist groups and their philosophical underpinnings.
